comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Her wikipedia entry: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bodil_Schmidt-Nielsen Her father was a Nobel laureate (1920, Physiology/Medicine). Here's her house (scroll down) from 1958-1964, in Durham NC: www.trianglemodernisthouses.com/sprinkle.htm

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Of the children: Mimi (1947-1984) died in her thirties from complications related to epilepsy; there is a fund in her memory at Carolina Friends School: www.cfsnc.org/page.cfm?p=902 Bent (b. 1944) is on the technical staff at Mitsubishi Electric Research Laboratories in San Diego, and an external collaborator on the Mind Machine Project at MIT; he seems to do work on speech recognition interfaces: www.merl.com/people/?user=bent www.mindmachineproject.org/ Astrid (b. 1941) is also a scientist interested in speech perception and cognitive processes, working at the Office of Naval Research: gamma.cs.unc.edu/events/workshops/wihave-02/speakers/asn.... www.informatik.uni-trier.de/~ley/db/indices/a-tree/s/Schm...

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Astrid's t-shirt is for this camp (still operating): www.enf.org/

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/11418107@N02] Thank you for adding profiles of the family! 
And I love the Eagle's Nest camp link. Fun fact.

Susannah
Smithsonian Institution Archives
